turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm thinking of joining a hackathon, but I'm a bit overwhelmed. Any tips on where to start?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hi there! That's great! Hackathons are a fantastic experience. First, I'd recommend identifying your skills and interests. What kind of projects do you enjoy working on? Are you more backend-focused, frontend, AI/ML, or something else? Knowing this will help you choose a hackathon that aligns with your abilities.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I get that. I'm mostly interested in full-stack web development, and I'm okay with Javascript, Python, and a bit of Java. But how do I find a team? I don't know anyone else who's interested!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Finding a team can be tricky, but don't worry! Many hackathons have platforms or dedicated time slots for team formation. Look for opportunities to introduce yourself, mention your skills (JS, Python, Java), and the kind of project you'd like to work on. Online forums or Discord channels associated with the hackathon are also good places to connect with potential teammates. Alternatively, focus on solo work, many people do.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's somewhat helpful, but what if my team's idea is terrible? Like, genuinely unsalvageable. I don't want to spend the whole weekend on a dead end. What's your advice then?
